Articles.Content:
Ok, decided that I would make a mission catalogue, similar in nature to Zoo's SSM series. Like his, you may make any type of payload you wish and ask for whatever type of orbit or mission you want to send the satellite on. Send me the payload, and I will make any rocket necessary to make the mission possible. I will use various mods including mechjeb and will do my best to provide evidence that said payload is being attempted for launch. If you want to use modded parts, please ask what mods I use and I will try to provide a list for you. Each payload sent in will be assigned to a mission number. My only precautionary measure for you is, because every rocket is unique to the payload and mission, please build in enough parachutes to allow for recovery of satellite if a launch failure occurs.

- - - Updated - - -

please note, payloads can also include crews

Mods installed:

FASA

KW Rocketry

Lionhead

Infernal Robotics

any of Raidernick's stuff

ISS stuff

Mir Stuff

Edited October 4, 2015 by Sampa
I might have a satellite, but currently I have no idea what to send. My probe is already slated for SSM-13, so maybe a stock Sun observer satellite?

Sure thing! Put you at the top of the list! Make sure to follow the steps to make it viable (we are ALL about the safety of the probe after a few...past incedents)

- - - Updated - - -

Main Launches will begin once I trim my mods down to a level where I won't crash every 5 seconds

Ok, here is a pic of my first satellite we built for ourselves: Caster 1

Just reached orbit, but the solar panels it was supposed to have were destroyed during the launch

Edited September 29, 2015 by Sampa
I have one mission for SSM-16 and a future undetermined one, but will definitely contribute to this program
Nice! For me! I am a lover of mods! 90% of my game is mods
Ok, I was informed that the picture for Caster 1 was too dark to be seen, so I retook it:
Awesome looking satellite!

Ok, Caster 2 was a complete success, but I failed to grab a picture of it (dangit). Also, Caster 3 was a partial success. Here is the final satellite of the Caster series, Caster 4. This was placed in a 90 km orbit at a whopping 70 degree inclination
Dimensions of the rocket? Is it 2.5, 1.25 or 3.75 m

I can handle payloads up to 5.0 meter!

(KW Rocketry)

For that satellite, base was about 2.5 with an upper stage at 1.25 + boosters
This could be interesting....what mod are the antennas from?
the bottom one is from Raidernick's Soviet capsule mod. The longer, yellow one is from Frizzank/NathenKell's FASA pack
Oh well, great! Time to make the transfer stage a poodle!

Oh well, great! Time to make the transfer stage a poodle!

Sweet! Can't wait to see and launch it!
Ok, adding a list of a few part mods that I presently have installed, if you wish to use them.
Do you also transport interplanetary probes? I've got an Eve probe lying around in a warehouse here.

We can give interplanetary probes a try! I have no question in my mind about whether or not we can handle this request! Send it my way!

Also, recent addition to our growing number of constellations in orbit:

Eltis 1

Javascript is disabled. View full album

>Download<

A few notes:

  • THE EEV is nuclear powered, no need to extend any panels or activate fuelcells.
  • According to our simulations, the probe is capable of aerocapture - no need to waste fuel to decelerate
  • The EEV does not have enough fuel to leave kerbin - you will have to provide a booster stage to send it on it's way to Eve.
  • 100% Stock

http://i.imgur.com/MnPz93v.png?1

>Download<

A few notes:

  • THE EEV is nuclear powered, no need to extend any panels or activate fuelcells.

  • According to our simulations, the probe is capable of aerocapture - no need to waste fuel to decelerate

  • The EEV does not have enough fuel to leave kerbin - you will have to provide a booster stage to send it on it's way to Eve.

  • 100% Stock

I have two missions for you: Origin 1 and an Eve cubesat.

Origin 1 is a asteroid probe

http://www./download/wcq8wc5z4dx3aaw/Origin_1.craft

And the Eve cubesat is designed to ride along with EEV

http://www./download/hua88umzzzz1pl4/Eve_Cubesat.craft

(tweakscale is also required for Origin 1's claw)

Edited October 11, 2015 by Voyager275
Thank you! Will put this onto a rocket as soon as possible!
Postponed on account of being grounded
